blackdoor.crypto

Class SHE

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackdoor.crypto.SHE

  • public class SHE
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    nfischer3 Secure hash encryption, uses hash algorithms in CTR mode for mirrored, symmetric encryption.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static SHE getInstance()
      Gets a cipher with default algorithm configuration (SHA512, 64 byte block)
      static SHE getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm)
      Gets a cipher using the specified algorithm.

      Initializes the cipher with key and IV

      byte[] update(byte[] input)
      Continues a multiple-part encryption or decryption operation (depending on how this cipher was initialized), processing another data part.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SHE getInstance()
        Gets a cipher with default algorithm configuration (SHA512, 64 byte block)
        Returns:
        An instance of an un-configured cipher

      • getInstance

        public static SHE getInstance(java.lang.String algorithm)
                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Gets a cipher using the specified algorithm. The cipher will have a block size based on the chosen algorithm. Larger block sizes are typically faster when encrypting data larger than the block size.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Any hash algorithm, see java's standard names document.
        Returns:
        An instance of an un-configured cipher
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • isConfigured

        public boolean isConfigured()

      • init

        public byte[] init(byte[] key)
        Initializes the cipher with key, creates a random IV to use with the cipher.
        Parameters:
        key - A key to encrypt with. Key can be any length but a key longer than the block size will run more slowly.
        Returns:
        An IV that has been created for this cipher to use. IV will be the same length as the key.

      • init

        public void init(byte[] IV,
        byte[] key)
        Initializes the cipher with key and IV
        Parameters:
        IV - An initialization vector to use for the cipher.
        key - A key to encrypt with.

      • update

        public byte[] update(byte[] input)
        Continues a multiple-part encryption or decryption operation (depending on how this cipher was initialized), processing another data part. The bytes in the input buffer are processed, and the result is stored in a new buffer. If input has a length of zero, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        input -
        Returns:

      • zeroKey

        public void zeroKey()
        Zero's out memory where the key is stored. After calling this method init() needs to be called again.
